questions.question: Why is a yellowish-orange beam seen at the far end of the container?

answers.a: Because shorter wavelengths are scattered, and longer wavelengths remain in the beam.
answers.b: Because longer wavelengths are scattered more in the container.
answers.c: Because shorter wavelengths are absorbed, leaving only longer wavelengths.
answers.d: Because longer wavelength part is refracting more in the container.
